ch.hevs.cloudio.endpoint

Interface CloudioEndpointService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CloudioEndpoint

    public interface CloudioEndpointService
    An CloudioEndpoint is the root object of any connection of a device or a gateway to cloud.io. The CloudioEndpointService is exposed by the cloud.io OSGi container in order to enable other OSGi bundles to register and remove new nodes within the endpoint.

    • Method Detail

      • isOnline

        boolean isOnline()
        Returns true if the endpoint is connected to the central message broker, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        True if the endpoint is online, false otherwise.

      • addEndpointListener

        void addEndpointListener(CloudioEndpointListener listener)
        Adds the given listener to the endpoint service.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to add.

      • removeEndpointListener

        void removeEndpointListener(CloudioEndpointListener listener)
        Removes the given listener from the endpoint service.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to add.

      • addNode

        void addNode(java.lang.String nodeName,
             CloudioNode node)
      throws DuplicateNamedItemException
        Adds the given node to the endpoint. The name of the node needs to be unique, otherwise the method will fail with an DuplicateNamedItemException.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Name to give to the node.
        node - Reference to the node instance to add.
        Throws:
        DuplicateNamedItemException - If a node with the given name already exists.

      • addNode

        <T extends CloudioNode> T addNode(java.lang.String nodeName,
                                  java.lang.Class<T> nodeClass)
                           throws InvalidCloudioNodeException,
                                  DuplicateNamedItemException
        Adds a new node instance of the given node class to the endpoint. The name of the node needs to be unique, otherwise the method will fail with an DuplicateNamedItemException. Note that the node class must dispose a default constructor in order to let the method create an instance of the class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the node class.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Name to give to the node.
        nodeClass - The class of the node to instantiate.
        Returns:
        Reference to the new instance of the given node class.
        Throws:
        DuplicateNamedItemException - If a node with the given name already exists.
        InvalidCloudioNodeException

      • removeNode

        void removeNode(CloudioNode node)
        Removes the given node from the endpoint if the node actually is part of the endpoint. If the node was not contained in the endpoint, the method will do nothing at all.
        Parameters:
        node - Node to remove.

      • removeNode

        void removeNode(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Removes the node with the given name from the endpoint if the node actually is part of the endpoint. If the endpoint does not contain a node with the given name, the method will do nothing at all.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Name of the node to remove.

      • getNode

        <T extends CloudioNode> T getNode(java.lang.String nodeName)
                           throws java.lang.ClassCastException
        Returns the node with the given name that was registered within cloud.iO or null if no such node is present.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Subclass of node.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Name of the node to return a reference to.
        Returns:
        A reference to registered node or null if no node with the given name exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - If the node could not be casted to the target type
